content: Colombia has established a new marine protected area in the Caribbean Sea, safeguarding crucial coral reefs and diverse marine wildlife. This significant conservation effort will protect approximately 3,000 square kilometers of ocean, including vital habitats for numerous species. The creation of this reserve demonstrates Colombia's commitment to marine conservation and contributes to global efforts to protect 30% of the world's oceans by 2030.
source_headline: Colombia Creates New Marine Reserve, Protecting Coral Reefs and Wildlife in the Caribbean Sea - National Geographic Society Newsroom
